019
020package com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.xpath;
021
022import java.util.List;
023
024import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.DetailAST;
025import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.utils.TokenUtil;
026import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.utils.XpathUtil;
027import net.sf.saxon.om.AxisInfo;
028import net.sf.saxon.om.NodeInfo;
029import net.sf.saxon.tree.iter.ArrayIterator;
030import net.sf.saxon.tree.iter.AxisIterator;
031import net.sf.saxon.tree.iter.EmptyIterator;
032import net.sf.saxon.tree.iter.SingleNodeIterator;
033import net.sf.saxon.tree.util.Navigator;
034import net.sf.saxon.type.Type;
035
036/**
037 * Represents element node of Xpath-tree.
038 *
039 */
040public class ElementNode extends AbstractNode {
041
042    /** String literal for text attribute. */
043    private static final String TEXT_ATTRIBUTE_NAME = "text";
044
045    /** Constant for optimization. */
046    private static final AbstractNode[] EMPTY_ABSTRACT_NODE_ARRAY = new AbstractNode[0];
047
048    /** The root node. */
049    private final AbstractNode root;
050
051    /** The parent of the current node. */
052    private final AbstractNode parent;
053
054    /** The ast node. */
055    private final DetailAST detailAst;
056
057    /** Represents text of the DetailAST. */
058    private final String text;
059
060    /** Represents index among siblings. */
061    private final int indexAmongSiblings;
062
063    /** The text attribute node. */
064    private AttributeNode attributeNode;
065
066    /**
067     * Creates a new {@code ElementNode} instance.
068     *
069     * @param root {@code Node} root of the tree
070     * @param parent {@code Node} parent of the current node
071     * @param detailAst reference to {@code DetailAST}
072     */
073    public ElementNode(AbstractNode root, AbstractNode parent, DetailAST detailAst) {
074        super(root.getTreeInfo());
075        this.parent = parent;
076        this.root = root;
077        this.detailAst = detailAst;
078        text = TokenUtil.getTokenName(detailAst.getType());
079        indexAmongSiblings = parent.getChildren().size();
080        createTextAttribute();
081        createChildren();
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * Iterates children of the current node and
086     * recursively creates new Xpath-nodes.
087     */
088    private void createChildren() {
089        DetailAST currentChild = detailAst.getFirstChild();
090        while (currentChild != null) {
091            final AbstractNode child = new ElementNode(root, this, currentChild);
092            addChild(child);
093            currentChild = currentChild.getNextSibling();
094        }
095    }
096
097    /**
098     * Returns attribute value. Throws {@code UnsupportedOperationException} in case,
099     * when name of the attribute is not equal to 'text'.
100     * @param namespace namespace
101     * @param localPart actual name of the attribute
102     * @return attribute value
103     */
104    @Override
105    public String getAttributeValue(String namespace, String localPart) {
106        final String result;
107        if (TEXT_ATTRIBUTE_NAME.equals(localPart)) {
108            if (attributeNode == null) {
109                result = null;
110            }
111            else {
112                result = attributeNode.getStringValue();
113            }
114        }
115        else {
116            result = null;
117        }
118        return result;
119    }
120
121    /**
122     * Returns local part.
123     * @return local part
124     */
125    @Override
126    public String getLocalPart() {
127        return text;
128    }
129
130    /**
131     * Returns type of the node.
132     * @return node kind
133     */
134    @Override
135    public int getNodeKind() {
136        return Type.ELEMENT;
137    }
138
139    /**
140     * Returns parent.
141     * @return parent
142     */
143    @Override
144    public NodeInfo getParent() {
145        return parent;
146    }
147
148    /**
149     * Returns root.
150     * @return root
151     */
152    @Override
153    public NodeInfo getRoot() {
154        return root;
155    }
156
157    /**
158     * Determines axis iteration algorithm. Throws {@code UnsupportedOperationException} in case,
159     * when there is no axis iterator for given axisNumber.
160     *
161     * @param axisNumber element from {@code AxisInfo}
162     * @return {@code AxisIterator} object
163     */
164    @Override
165    public AxisIterator iterateAxis(byte axisNumber) {
166        final AxisIterator result;
167        switch (axisNumber) {
168            case AxisInfo.ANCESTOR:
169                try (AxisIterator iterator = new Navigator.AncestorEnumeration(this, false)) {
170                    result = iterator;
171                }
172                break;
173            case AxisInfo.ANCESTOR_OR_SELF:
174                try (AxisIterator iterator = new Navigator.AncestorEnumeration(this, true)) {
175                    result = iterator;
176                }
177                break;
178            case AxisInfo.ATTRIBUTE:
179                try (AxisIterator iterator = SingleNodeIterator.makeIterator(attributeNode)) {
180                    result = iterator;
181                }
182                break;
183            case AxisInfo.CHILD:
184                if (hasChildNodes()) {
185                    try (AxisIterator iterator = new ArrayIterator.OfNodes(
186                            getChildren().toArray(EMPTY_ABSTRACT_NODE_ARRAY))) {
187                        result = iterator;
188                    }
189                }
190                else {
191                    result = EmptyIterator.OfNodes.THE_INSTANCE;
192                }
193                break;
194            case AxisInfo.DESCENDANT:
195                if (hasChildNodes()) {
196                    try (AxisIterator iterator =
197                                 new Navigator.DescendantEnumeration(this, false, true)) {
198                        result = iterator;
199                    }
200                }
201                else {
202                    result = EmptyIterator.OfNodes.THE_INSTANCE;
203                }
204                break;
205            case AxisInfo.DESCENDANT_OR_SELF:
206                try (AxisIterator iterator =
207                             new Navigator.DescendantEnumeration(this, true, true)) {
208                    result = iterator;
209                }
210                break;
211            case AxisInfo.PARENT:
212                try (AxisIterator iterator = SingleNodeIterator.makeIterator(parent)) {
213                    result = iterator;
214                }
215                break;
216            case AxisInfo.SELF:
217                try (AxisIterator iterator = SingleNodeIterator.makeIterator(this)) {
218                    result = iterator;
219                }
220                break;
221            case AxisInfo.FOLLOWING_SIBLING:
222                result = getFollowingSiblingsIterator();
223                break;
224            case AxisInfo.PRECEDING_SIBLING:
225                result = getPrecedingSiblingsIterator();
226                break;
227            case AxisInfo.FOLLOWING:
228                try (AxisIterator iterator = new FollowingEnumeration(this)) {
229                    result = iterator;
230                }
231                break;
232            case AxisInfo.PRECEDING:
233                try (AxisIterator iterator = new Navigator.PrecedingEnumeration(this, true)) {
234                    result = iterator;
235                }
236                break;
237            default:
238                throw throwUnsupportedOperationException();
239        }
240        return result;
241    }
242
243    /**
244     * Returns line number.
245     * @return line number
246     */
247    @Override
248    public int getLineNumber() {
249        return detailAst.getLineNo();
250    }
251
252    /**
253     * Returns column number.
254     * @return column number
255     */
256    @Override
257    public int getColumnNumber() {
258        return detailAst.getColumnNo();
259    }
260
261    /**
262     * Getter method for token type.
263     * @return token type
264     */
265    @Override
266    public int getTokenType() {
267        return detailAst.getType();
268    }
269
270    /**
271     * Returns underlying node.
272     * @return underlying node
273     */
274    @Override
275    public DetailAST getUnderlyingNode() {
276        return detailAst;
277    }
278
279    /**
280     * Returns preceding sibling axis iterator.
281     * @return iterator
282     */
283    private AxisIterator getPrecedingSiblingsIterator() {
284        final AxisIterator result;
285        if (indexAmongSiblings == 0) {
286            result = EmptyIterator.OfNodes.THE_INSTANCE;
287        }
288        else {
289            try (AxisIterator iterator = new ArrayIterator.OfNodes(
290                    getPrecedingSiblings().toArray(EMPTY_ABSTRACT_NODE_ARRAY))) {
291                result = iterator;
292            }
293        }
294        return result;
295    }
296
297    /**
298     * Returns following sibling axis iterator.
299     * @return iterator
300     */
301    private AxisIterator getFollowingSiblingsIterator() {
302        final AxisIterator result;
303        if (indexAmongSiblings == parent.getChildren().size() - 1) {
304            result = EmptyIterator.OfNodes.THE_INSTANCE;
305        }
306        else {
307            try (AxisIterator iterator = new ArrayIterator.OfNodes(
308                    getFollowingSiblings().toArray(EMPTY_ABSTRACT_NODE_ARRAY))) {
309                result = iterator;
310            }
311        }
312        return result;
313    }
314
315    /**
316     * Returns following siblings of the current node.
317     * @return siblings
318     */
319    private List<AbstractNode> getFollowingSiblings() {
320        final List<AbstractNode> siblings = parent.getChildren();
321        return siblings.subList(indexAmongSiblings + 1, siblings.size());
322    }
323
324    /**
325     * Returns preceding siblings of the current node.
326     * @return siblings
327     */
328    private List<AbstractNode> getPrecedingSiblings() {
329        final List<AbstractNode> siblings = parent.getChildren();
330        return siblings.subList(0, indexAmongSiblings);
331    }
332
333    /**
334     * Checks if token type supports {@code @text} attribute,
335     * extracts its value, creates {@code AttributeNode} object and returns it.
336     * Value can be accessed using {@code @text} attribute.
337     */
338    private void createTextAttribute() {
339        AttributeNode attribute = null;
340        if (XpathUtil.supportsTextAttribute(detailAst)) {
341            attribute = new AttributeNode(TEXT_ATTRIBUTE_NAME,
342                    XpathUtil.getTextAttributeValue(detailAst));
343        }
344        attributeNode = attribute;
345    }
346
347    /**
348     * Returns UnsupportedOperationException exception.
349     * @return UnsupportedOperationException exception
350     */
351    private static UnsupportedOperationException throwUnsupportedOperationException() {
352        return new UnsupportedOperationException("Operation is not supported");
353    }
354
355    /**
356     * Implementation of the following axis, in terms of the child and following-sibling axes.
357     */
358    private static final class FollowingEnumeration implements AxisIterator {
359        /** Following-sibling axis iterator. */
360        private AxisIterator siblingEnum;
361        /** Child axis iterator. */
362        private AxisIterator descendEnum;
363
364        /**
365         * Create an iterator over the "following" axis.
366         * @param start the initial context node.
367         */
368        /* package */ FollowingEnumeration(NodeInfo start) {
369            siblingEnum = start.iterateAxis(AxisInfo.FOLLOWING_SIBLING);
370        }
371
372        /**
373         * Get the next item in the sequence.
374         * @return the next Item. If there are no more nodes, return null.
375         */
376        @Override
377        public NodeInfo next() {
378            NodeInfo result = null;
379            if (descendEnum != null) {
380                result = descendEnum.next();
381            }
382
383            if (result == null) {
384                descendEnum = null;
385                result = siblingEnum.next();
386                if (result == null) {
387                    siblingEnum = null;
388                }
389                else {
390                    descendEnum = new Navigator.DescendantEnumeration(result, true, false);
391                    result = next();
392                }
393            }
394            return result;
395        }
396    }
397
398}
